data_sources: Target ALS Global Natural History Study

stage_definitions.early: Newly diagnosed, within 2 years of symptom onset, FVC >80%, independent in daily activities
stage_definitions.mid: 2-5 years from diagnosis, FVC 50-80%, some assistance needed, may use walking aids
stage_definitions.advanced: 5+ years, FVC <50%, significant disability, may need NIV/BiPAP support
stage_definitions.ventilator_dependent: 24/7 invasive or non-invasive ventilation, fully dependent for care

benefit_type_legend.slows_progression: Reduces rate of functional decline - does NOT reverse damage
benefit_type_legend.may_slow: Shows promise but not definitively proven to slow progression
benefit_type_legend.neuroprotection: Protects remaining neurons from death - does NOT restore dead ones
benefit_type_legend.symptom_management: Treats symptoms only - no effect on disease course
benefit_type_legend.functional_restoration: May help restore some lost functions (rare, experimental)
benefit_type_legend.neuron_regeneration: Aims to replace dead motor neurons (highly experimental)

approved_treatments.mechanism: Glutamate antagonist - reduces excitotoxic damage to motor neurons by blocking excess glutamate release

benefit_classification.does_it_reverse_damage: NO - Cannot restore dead neurons or reverse muscle atrophy
benefit_classification.does_it_restore_function: NO - Does not improve existing symptoms
benefit_classification.what_it_actually_does: Modestly extends survival by reducing rate of motor neuron death. Does NOT bring back lost functions.

quantified_benefit.survival_extension: 2-3 months in clinical trials; 6-21 months in real-world studies
quantified_benefit.functional_improvement: NONE - Only slows decline, does not improve
quantified_benefit.evidence_quality: Strong (multiple Phase 3 trials, 25+ years of use)

newly_diagnosed.expected_outcome: Best chance to extend survival if started early
newly_diagnosed.recommendation: STRONGLY RECOMMENDED - Start immediately upon diagnosis

mid_stage.recommendation: RECOMMENDED - Continue if already on it, start if not

advanced_ventilator.expected_outcome: Limited additional benefit at this stage
advanced_ventilator.recommendation: OPTIONAL - May continue for marginal benefit, discuss with neurologist

approved_treatments.realistic_expectations: This is NOT a cure. It will NOT make you stronger or restore lost abilities. It MAY help you live somewhat longer by slowing the rate of decline. Most patients and families do not notice any visible difference while taking it.

india_info.accessibility: Widely available. Most affordable approved ALS treatment in India.

approved_treatments.mechanism: Free radical scavenger - reduces oxidative stress that damages motor neurons

benefit_classification.does_it_restore_function: NO - Does not improve existing weakness
benefit_classification.what_it_actually_does: Reduces rate of functional decline by ~33% in EARLY-STAGE patients only. No proven benefit in advanced disease.

quantified_benefit.who_benefits: ONLY early-stage: <2 years from onset, FVC >80%, living independently
quantified_benefit.who_does_NOT_benefit: Advanced patients, ventilator-dependent, >2 years disease duration
quantified_benefit.evidence_quality: Moderate (Japanese trial showed benefit in specific subgroup only)

newly_diagnosed.expected_outcome: May slow decline by ~33% if started within 2 years of symptoms
newly_diagnosed.recommendation: CONSIDER if: <2 years onset, FVC >80%, independent living

mid_stage.expected_outcome: Limited evidence of benefit beyond early stage
mid_stage.recommendation: NOT RECOMMENDED - Cost may not justify uncertain benefit

advanced_ventilator.expected_outcome: No proven benefit, high cost, logistical burden
advanced_ventilator.recommendation: NOT RECOMMENDED - Focus resources on comfort care

approved_treatments.realistic_expectations: This drug only works in EARLY disease. If you are already using a wheelchair or ventilator, this drug is unlikely to help. It requires daily IV infusions for 14 days each month - significant time and cost burden.

india_info.accessibility: Available but requires hospital visits for IV infusion
india_info.administration_challenge: Daily IV for 14 days/month - major logistical burden

approved_treatments.mechanism: Antisense oligonucleotide - destroys the RNA that produces toxic SOD1 protein

benefit_classification.does_it_reverse_damage: PARTIALLY - May stabilize and prevent further damage, some patients show stabilization
benefit_classification.does_it_restore_function: POSSIBLY - Long-term data shows some patients maintain or regain function
benefit_classification.what_it_actually_does: Directly targets the CAUSE of disease in SOD1 patients. Significantly reduces toxic protein levels. May halt or slow progression more effectively than other drugs.

quantified_benefit.functional_outcome: Some patients show stabilization or slight improvement
quantified_benefit.who_benefits: ONLY patients with confirmed SOD1 genetic mutation (~2% of all ALS)
quantified_benefit.evidence_quality: Strong for SOD1 patients (Phase 3 VALOR trial)

newly_diagnosed_sod1.expected_outcome: Best chance to halt disease if started before significant damage
newly_diagnosed_sod1.recommendation: STRONGLY RECOMMENDED if SOD1 positive - start immediately

mid_stage_sod1.expected_outcome: May stabilize disease, prevent further decline
mid_stage_sod1.recommendation: RECOMMENDED - Still beneficial even with some progression

advanced_sod1.expected_outcome: May prevent further decline but cannot reverse existing damage

non_sod1_patients.expected_outcome: This drug does NOT work for non-SOD1 ALS

approved_treatments.realistic_expectations: This is a TARGETED therapy - it ONLY works if you have SOD1 mutation (about 2% of ALS patients). Get genetic testing first. If positive, this is currently the most promising option. If negative, this drug will not help you.

india_info.future_access: Named Patient Import via Form 12B. Genetic testing available at NIMHANS, DNA Labs India (Rs 20,000), MedGenome.

approved_treatments.mechanism: Ultra-high dose Vitamin B12 (methylcobalamin) - exact neuroprotective mechanism under study

benefit_classification.what_it_actually_does: Slowed functional decline by 43% in EARLY-STAGE patients (<12 months from onset) in Japanese trial.

quantified_benefit.who_benefits: ONLY very early stage: <12 months from symptom onset

newly_diagnosed_under_12_months.recommendation: Worth considering IF available - currently Japan only

beyond_12_months.expected_outcome: No evidence of benefit beyond very early stage
beyond_12_months.recommendation: NOT APPLICABLE - Trial only included <12 month patients

approved_treatments.realistic_expectations: This is a Japanese-only drug as of December 2025. It only showed benefit in patients within their FIRST YEAR of symptoms. Not available in India or most other countries.

india_info.status: Japan only. No international expansion announced.

approved_treatments.mechanism: Dextromethorphan + Quinidine - treats involuntary emotional expression (PBA)

benefit_classification.what_it_actually_does: Controls involuntary laughing/crying episodes (Pseudobulbar Affect). Does NOT affect disease progression at all.

approved_treatments.realistic_expectations: This drug ONLY treats a specific symptom (uncontrollable laughing or crying). It has ZERO effect on ALS progression, muscle strength, or survival. It improves quality of life for those with PBA.

india_info.status: Can be imported or compounded from individual components

withdrawn_treatments.reason: PHOENIX Phase 3 trial completely FAILED (p=0.667). No benefit over placebo.
withdrawn_treatments.warning: Do NOT pay for or attempt to obtain this drug. It does not work.

benefit_classification.what_it_promises: 27% reduction in disease progression, 12-month survival benefit in 'normal progressors'

clinical_trials.india_potential: HIGH - Oral pill, likely to have generics if approved

clinical_trials.mechanism: Sigma-1 receptor agonist - targets speech and bulbar function

benefit_classification.does_it_restore_function: NO - but may preserve speech longer
benefit_classification.what_it_promises: 32% slower overall progression, 93% reduction in speech deterioration in early rapidly-progressive patients

stage_specific_applicability.best_for: Early stage with rapid progression, especially bulbar-onset
stage_specific_applicability.not_for: Advanced disease, those already on ventilator

clinical_trials.mechanism: Gold nanocrystals - restores cellular energy production

benefit_classification.does_it_reverse_damage: UNCLEAR - may protect against further damage
benefit_classification.what_it_promises: 73% reduction in mortality risk, 6.5-month survival benefit

clinical_trials.india_potential: MEDIUM - Novel nanomedicine, likely expensive initially

clinical_trials.mechanism: Stem cell therapy - delivers neurotrophic factors to support surviving neurons

benefit_classification.does_it_restore_function: POSSIBLY - some patients showed improvement in previous trials
benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Aims to stabilize or slow decline by nourishing remaining neurons

stage_specific_applicability.not_for: Advanced disease - previous Phase 3 failed due to including too many advanced patients

clinical_trials.critical_warning: AVOID unregulated stem cell clinics in India claiming similar treatments. They are NOT the same as NurOwn.
clinical_trials.india_potential: LOW - Requires travel to US trial sites

clinical_trials.mechanism: ASO targeting FUS mutation - stops production of toxic FUS protein

benefit_classification.does_it_reverse_damage: POSSIBLY - exceptional improvement seen in some patients
benefit_classification.does_it_restore_function: POSSIBLY - 2 of 12 patients showed remarkable improvement
benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Halt or reverse progression in FUS-ALS (aggressive juvenile form)

stage_specific_applicability.best_for: FUS mutation carriers at any stage

clinical_trials.india_potential: LOW initially - requires intrathecal injection, genetic confirmation

clinical_trials.mechanism: ASO that restores Stathmin-2 protein - addresses TDP-43 pathology in 97% of ALS

benefit_classification.primary_effect: TARGETS ROOT CAUSE IN MOST ALS PATIENTS
benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Addresses the fundamental problem in 97% of ALS cases (TDP-43 pathology)

stage_specific_applicability.potential_for: ALL ALS patients (not just genetic subtypes)
stage_specific_applicability.current_status: Too early to know stage-specific benefits

clinical_trials.india_relevance: EXTREMELY HIGH - Would apply to majority of ALS patients, not just genetic subtypes

clinical_trials.mechanism: Lab-grown motor neurons from stem cells to REPLACE dead neurons

benefit_classification.does_it_reverse_damage: AIMS TO - by replacing dead motor neurons
benefit_classification.does_it_restore_function: AIMS TO - if new neurons connect properly
benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Only therapy attempting to REGENERATE lost motor neurons

stage_specific_applicability.realistic_timeline: 5-10+ years from widespread availability even if successful

clinical_trials.india_potential: MEDIUM - Allogeneic 'off-the-shelf' product, high future import potential unlike autologous therapies

clinical_trials.mechanism: Ciprofloxacin (RNA processing/Iron chelation) + Celecoxib (COX-2 inhibition) - combination synergy
clinical_trials.critical_warning: DO NOT attempt DIY with generic Ciprofloxacin + Celecoxib. PrimeC uses proprietary extended-release formulation. Generic versions risk antibiotic resistance and GI toxicity WITHOUT neuroprotective benefit.
clinical_trials.timeline: Health Canada submission 2025, Potential approval mid-2026
clinical_trials.india_potential: MEDIUM - Wait for regulatory approval. Do NOT self-compound.

clinical_trials.mechanism: Low-dose IL-2 + CTLA-4 Ig - enhances Regulatory T Cells (Tregs) which are dysfunctional in ALS

benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Boosts Treg function to control unchecked inflammation

stage_specific_applicability.best_for: Patients with inflammatory markers, early-to-mid stage

clinical_trials.india_potential: LOW - Early stage trial, no current access

clinical_trials.mechanism: mTOR inhibitor - induces autophagy to clear toxic protein aggregates (TDP-43)
clinical_trials.scientific_validity: Moderate (Phase 1 showed safety and biomarker engagement)

benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Activates cell 'garbage disposal' to clear TDP-43 aggregates

stage_specific_applicability.potential_for: All ALS patients with TDP-43 pathology (97%)

clinical_trials.india_potential: HIGH - Originally veterinary drug, may be accessible if repurposed

preclinical_research.concept: SARM1 is a protein that triggers axon self-destruction when neurons are stressed. Blocking SARM1 may keep the connections between motor neurons and muscles intact much longer.

benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Prevents axons from self-destructing even when neuron body is stressed. May preserve muscle connections longer.

preclinical_research.stage_applicability: Would benefit all stages by preserving remaining connections
preclinical_research.india_relevance: HIGH - Small molecule oral drug, ideal for generic manufacturing
preclinical_research.who_benefits: All ALS patients, but especially early-to-mid stage where more connections remain to protect

preclinical_research.concept: Uses CRISPR-Cas9 molecular scissors to cut out or correct the faulty gene sequence causing ALS. Could potentially be a one-time permanent fix for genetic forms.

benefit_classification.what_it_promises: Permanent correction of disease-causing gene - potential one-time cure

preclinical_research.stage_applicability: Would need to be applied early before extensive neuron death
preclinical_research.who_benefits: Patients with confirmed genetic mutations (SOD1, C9orf72, FUS). Genetic testing required to identify candidates.

preclinical_research.full_title: First Large-Scale Genome-Wide Association Study of ALS in South Asian Populations
preclinical_research.concept: A massive genetic study to identify risk factors, protective genes, and disease modifiers specific to South Asian populations. Indian ALS patients often show younger age of onset and slower disease progression, suggesting unique genetic factors.
preclinical_research.what_it_is: Large-scale genetic research including 2,000 Indian ALS patients via NIMHANS and AIIMS

india_sites.institution: NIMHANS (National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences), Bengaluru
india_sites.lead_researcher: Dr. Atchayaram Nalini - Professor of Neurology, Neuromuscular Specialist
india_sites.previous_work: 700+ Indian ALS patients already underwent whole exome sequencing

india_sites.institution: AIIMS (All India Institute of Medical Sciences), New Delhi

study_details.unique_observations: Indian ALS patients often have younger onset and slower progression - may have unique founder variants or protective genes

benefit_classification.what_it_promises: May discover India-specific genetic factors, protective genes, or new therapeutic targets applicable to Indian population

preclinical_research.stage_applicability: For future - discoveries may lead to new treatments for all stages
preclinical_research.india_relevance: VERY HIGH - First large-scale ALS GWAS in South Asia

participation.eligibility: Indian ALS patients diagnosed at NIMHANS or AIIMS
participation.cost: FREE genetic testing for eligible patients
participation.how_to_participate: Contact NIMHANS Neurology Department or AIIMS Neurology

who_benefits: All current patients: Free genetic testing
Future patients: New treatments targeting India-specific genes
Families: Genetic counseling and risk assessment
Global ALS community: Diverse genetic data improves understanding

previous_indian_genetic_findings.rare_variants: SETX, ALS2, DISC1, CNTN4, MATR3 identified in Indian cohort

communication_technology.status: FDA-listed, Medical Device, Proven for ALS
communication_technology.what_it_is: Industry-leading eye-tracking communication system specifically designed for ALS patients over 15+ years of development
communication_technology.how_it_works: Infrared eye tracker mounts on computer screen, tracks eye gaze to control mouse cursor and on-screen keyboard. I-Series includes built-in computer, speakers, and communication software.
key_advantages: 15+ years ALS-specific optimization - handles droopy eyelids (ptosis), dry eyes, progressive lenses
Minimal calibration required - fastest re-tracking if user looks away
Medical-grade reliability - designed for 24/7 use
Outdoor capability - works in bright sunlight (critical for wheelchair users)
24/7 support hotline - emergency assistance available
Insurance coverage - typically covered by health insurance/charities in many countries
limitations: Screen-mounted - requires screen in front of user
Tracking box limitation - head must stay within specific range
Not portable - designed for fixed setup

india_availability.how_to_get: Contact Tobii Dynavox directly via tobiidynavox.com or medical equipment distributors

communication_technology.who_should_use: ALL advanced-stage ALS patients needing reliable computer control and communication. This is the proven standard.
communication_technology.comparison_to_tobii: This IS the gold standard that all alternatives are compared against
communication_technology.evidence_quality: HIGHEST - 90%+ of advanced ALS patients worldwide use Tobii Dynavox products

communication_technology.status: Research device, NOT medical device, Unproven for ALS
communication_technology.what_it_is: Research-grade wearable eye tracker that CAN control Windows mouse through AprilTag surface tracking, but requires significant technical setup
communication_technology.how_it_works: Glasses with eye cameras track gaze direction. Scene camera sees AprilTag markers placed on monitor corners. Python software maps gaze to screen coordinates and moves mouse cursor. Requires OptiKey software for full keyboard control.
key_advantages: ZERO calibration required - uses AI/deep learning to track eyes
No head positioning box - works even if head moves
Portable - can use with any computer if AprilTags present
Research-grade accuracy - 200 Hz sampling, 1.3° accuracy
Open-source ecosystem - fully customizable
critical_limitations: NOT plug-and-play - requires Python programming, command line, GitHub knowledge
5x more expensive - €6,250 (~₹5.6 lakhs) vs Tobii PCEye 5 at ₹1.35 lakhs
Battery life only 4 hours - requires mid-day battery changes
Weight on head - 35-50g worn all day may cause fatigue
NO ALS-specific support - no 24/7 hotline, community forums only
Unproven for ptosis - no data on droopy eyelid performance
ZERO reviews from ALS patients - no proven track record in ALS community
communication_technology.setup_complexity: HIGH - Requires tech-savvy person or programmer to set up Python environment, install real-time-screen-gaze package, configure AprilTag markers, integrate with OptiKey

india_availability.how_to_get: Order directly from pupil-labs.com, international shipping
india_availability.setup_support: Hire CS student or programmer for ₹5,000-15,000 initial setup

communication_technology.who_should_use: ONLY if: (1) Tech-savvy family member available, (2) Early-stage ALS can help with setup, (3) Need multiple computer setups, (4) Budget available ~₹7 lakhs. NOT suitable as primary device without backup.

comparison_to_tobii.pros_vs_tobii: Calibration-free (huge advantage), portable, no tracking box
comparison_to_tobii.cons_vs_tobii: 5x cost, unproven for ALS, no medical support, battery life, setup complexity, no droopy eyelid testing

communication_technology.realistic_expectations: Technically capable but practically challenging for 24/7 reliability. Use as supplement/backup to Tobii, not as primary communication device.
communication_technology.evidence_quality: LOW for ALS - Zero published reviews from ALS patients. HIGH for research applications.

communication_technology.form_factor: Glasses frame with IR camera + pocket computer + bone conduction speaker
communication_technology.status: FDA-listed, CE-marked, Medical Device, Purpose-built for ALS
communication_technology.what_it_is: Israeli startup's wearable eye-tracking system specifically designed for ALS and locked-in syndrome. CRITICAL: Does NOT control Windows mouse - standalone audio communication only.
communication_technology.how_it_works: Eye gestures (look up/down/left/right, blink patterns) navigate audio menus. Pre-recorded messages play via bone conduction speaker. External speaker lets caregiver hear selections. Works completely without screen.
key_advantages: 20-minute training time - fastest learning curve of any system
Works without screen - use in bathroom, bed, car, anywhere
24/7 wearable - can sleep with device on, communicate immediately upon waking
8-hour battery life - full day use
Affordable - ~$300-500 (~₹45,000) vs $10,000+ for Tobii I-Series
FDA/CE certified - medical device certification
Clinical validation - tested in ICU settings, published in medical journals
critical_limitations: NOT for computer control - cannot type emails, browse web, control Windows
Pre-defined messages only - cannot create new phrases without helper
Limited vocabulary - menu-based system, not infinite like keyboard
Cannot replace Tobii - complements it, does not substitute

india_availability.how_to_get: Contact info@eyecontrol.co.il for India delivery quote
india_availability.import_considerations: Personal medical import allowed, budget extra ₹10,000-20,000 for customs

communication_technology.who_should_use: As COMPANION to Tobii, not replacement. Perfect for: 24/7 emergency communication, bed-bound patients, bathroom use, night-time alerts. Use BOTH if budget allows.

comparison_to_tobii.what_it_does_better: 24/7 wearable emergency communication, works lying down, no screen needed, affordable
comparison_to_tobii.what_tobii_does_better: Full computer control, typing, email, web browsing, complex communication

communication_technology.realistic_expectations: Solves critical gap: 2 AM emergency when Tobii is across room. Cannot replace computer control. Budget recommendation: Use BOTH if possible, choose Tobii if only one.
communication_technology.evidence_quality: MODERATE-HIGH - Clinical trials in ICU settings, published studies, but smaller user base than Tobii

communication_technology.form_factor: Screen-mounted gaming eye tracker + free open-source software
communication_technology.what_it_is: Free, open-source on-screen keyboard (OptiKey) paired with budget gaming eye tracker (Tobii Tracker 5) to achieve 85% of Tobii Dynavox functionality at 16% of cost
communication_technology.how_it_works: Tobii Eye Tracker 5 (gaming device) mounts on screen and tracks eyes. OptiKey software provides on-screen keyboard, mouse control, text-to-speech. User stares at keys to type.
key_advantages: FREE software - OptiKey is completely free forever, no license fees
85% of functionality at 16% of cost - $299 vs $1,800
Same sensor technology - Tobii Tracker 5 uses IS5 sensor (same as PCEye 5)
Active community - 4,300+ GitHub stars, actively maintained
Works with multiple trackers - not locked to one device
critical_limitations: Gaming hardware NOT medical-grade - no IP rating, not tested for outdoor use
Community support only - no 24/7 hotline, forum troubleshooting only
Calibration required - must follow dot targets (difficult for advanced patients)
No ALS-specific optimizations - not tested for ptosis, dry eyes, etc.
India availability uncertain - gaming tracker primarily sold in gaming markets
communication_technology.setup_complexity: MODERATE - Download OptiKey (free), install Tobii Tracker 5 drivers, calibrate, configure dwell time. No programming required but some computer literacy needed.

india_availability.how_to_get: Order Tobii Eye Tracker 5 from gaming.tobii.com (check India shipping) or gaming import services. Download OptiKey from optikey.org (free)

communication_technology.who_should_use: Budget-constrained users, early-stage ALS (can perform calibration), tech-comfortable users, those wanting to try eye tracking before major investment. Keep Tobii PCEye 5 as upgrade path.

comparison_to_tobii.cost_savings: ₹1,34,000 savings vs Tobii PCEye 5 + TD Control
comparison_to_tobii.what_you_sacrifice: Medical certification, guaranteed outdoor use, 24/7 support, ALS-specific optimizations
comparison_to_tobii.what_you_gain: Massive cost savings, open-source flexibility, community development

communication_technology.realistic_expectations: Excellent budget option for early-stage patients. May not be sufficient for advanced disease or outdoor wheelchair use. Consider as stepping stone to medical-grade system.
communication_technology.evidence_quality: MODERATE - Proven in ALS community forums, positive reviews, but not medical-grade validation

experimental_communication_tech.technology: Pupil Labs Neon + Custom Python Scripts
experimental_communication_tech.what_it_is: Using Pupil Labs Neon with custom Python scripts for advanced mouse control and multi-screen setups
experimental_communication_tech.who_can_try: Users with programming background or CS student helper, early-stage ALS patients who can assist with setup
experimental_communication_tech.risk_level: MEDIUM - Unproven for ALS, requires backup system
experimental_communication_tech.recommendation: Only as supplement to proven system, not as primary device

experimental_communication_tech.technology: Webcam + Head Tracking (Enable Viacam / Camera Mouse)
experimental_communication_tech.status: EXPERIMENTAL - Free but requires head movement
experimental_communication_tech.what_it_is: Free software that tracks head movement via webcam to control mouse. NOT eye tracking.
experimental_communication_tech.who_can_try: Early-stage patients with some head control remaining
experimental_communication_tech.critical_limitation: Requires head movement - NOT suitable for advanced ALS with zero head control
experimental_communication_tech.risk_level: LOW - Free to try, but limited applicability
experimental_communication_tech.recommendation: Try early in disease progression, have eye-tracking backup ready

experimental_communication_tech.what_it_is: Academic research projects using smartphone cameras and AprilTag markers for low-cost eye tracking
experimental_communication_tech.critical_limitation: Unreliable, unproven, no support, requires extensive troubleshooting
experimental_communication_tech.risk_level: HIGH - May waste time and money
experimental_communication_tech.recommendation: NOT RECOMMENDED for patients needing reliable communication. Research interest only.

key_research_hubs_india.description: Free trial navigation, launched Delhi December 2024

important_notes.relyvrio_warning: Relyvrio (AMX0035) WITHDRAWN August 2025 - Do NOT purchase or pursue this drug.
important_notes.realistic_expectations: Currently, NO approved drug can restore lost neurons, reverse muscle atrophy, or cure ALS. All approved drugs only SLOW decline to varying degrees. Except for Nuedexta (symptom only), none improve existing symptoms.
important_notes.genetic_testing_critical: With new targeted therapies (Tofersen-SOD1, Ulefnersen-FUS), genetic testing is now CRUCIAL. Available in India at Rs 20,000 (DNA Labs India).
important_notes.stem_cell_warning: AVOID unregulated stem cell clinics in India. They are NOT the same as clinical trial protocols and may be dangerous.
